alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 12 at 6:24PM MST until September 12 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 623 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was along a line extending from 7 miles east of Freeman to 6 miles south of Maricopa to near Olberg, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 172 and 188. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 138 and 156. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 139 and 155. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Maricopa, Bapchule, Freeman, Estrella Sailport, Olberg, San Tan Mountain Park, Blackwater, Ak- Chin Village, Sacaton and Santan. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
